title: it ligature
content: Does anyone know of some examples of a ligature for i and t - particularly in a slab serif font.
author: David Ford

comments.content: That's a rare one. Don't know a slab, but [Mrs Eaves](http://web.archive.org/web/20130423034908/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/emigre/mrs_eaves_roman_ot/?sample_text=See%20ligatures%20below.&acs_pt=36&acs_ss=3) has it.

If Aquila comes within your definition of slab serif, it has that ligature.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/aquila/bold/charmap.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130423034908/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/aquila/bold/charmap.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/aquila/bold/charmap.html")

Tim
